member.summary: Gets or sets the Style object that defines header visual appearance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the content that will represent the header of the inner instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the that represents the template of the header content.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value determining whether the control is in read only mode. If set to true, the control does not allow the user to modify its value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.EmptyContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the null text of the control. The null text is displayed when there is no value defined.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.EmptyContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the defining the visual appearance of the empty content of the control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.DisplayValueFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a string representing the value format for the control. The value format determines how the edited value is displayed on the screen. If not set, the current culture is used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.SelectorFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the selector format. This selector format defines how the different selector components will be ordered. By setting this property, you can also define which editable parts of the selector will be visible.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.ValueString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string representation of the current value. The string representation is the current value formatted according to the settings of the device and the control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of the class that represents the culture which is used to format the values of the control. If no culture is set, the default for the device environment is used.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the value range for the control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the value range for the control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the date value.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DateTimePicker.IsProperlyTemplated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this control is properly templated.
member.value: True if this instance is properly templated; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListPickerMode
member.summary: Defines the two possible modes for a .

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListPickerMode.Inline
member.summary: The number of items is up to 5 and the picker operates inline - that is it expands when clicked and collapses when focus is lost or selection is changed.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListPickerMode.Popup
member.summary: The number of items is more than 5 and the picker will display only the currently selected item. When clicked it will open a separate popup to display all the items.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadListPicker
member.summary: A control that allows for selecting an item from a predefined set of items. Two modes are available - if the picker contains up to 5 items they are displayed inline. If items are more than five, they are displayed in a separate popup RadWindow.
